posts.text:
congrads on making tough dicsion
i should be back in vegas in acouple of wks..should you have any questions please ask
peter

i,m using dr bouchner @ sloan-kerrtering..good bedside manner and as well know..just a suggest
but..please get 2nd opinion

just got off phone w/ sloan-kerrting..very up-set..no one knew where slides where..didnt know who i was..
long story short..lab was late in sending slides
after that started to give lady in nyc my background and she said "when can you come in'!!!!..what !!
took awhile but got it striaghtened out ...gggrrrr
s/k doc will review slides..within a week (we're almost @ 1 month) and let doc or me know (which one ???)
1 small step..i guess

you can contact via the web
set-up phone consult..well worth the time
we should hear something early next (i hope)
HEY ..may see ya in NYC !!! 
keep pressing..you only have 1 dad

GOT THE CALL FRON MSK..
doc said what with hi grade + t2 + prostate cancer..its a no brainer..out they come
have to call to set date..1st week of july in NYC
6-8hr operation...7-10 days in hospital..7days rest before flying back to vegas..up to 2mos if i want to drive back
didnt talk details..will do that when we get to new york
very relived the waiting is over..and now we can start getting "cancer free"..asked point blank.."will i be free"after operation..he said yes (will also take lumo nodes to be sure)
i'm sure i'll be asking abunch of questions..but for tonite..sipping wine and exhaling
thanks to all that have helped..and will help
peter
posts.topic: Not sure if I have it

posts.text:
here we go again..waiting..but your very strong and positive
hang in there

my biggest problem was the clots..took awhile to get thru that part..we all get past it
have a glass of wine and get a good nites sleep
peter

glad you made it thru
get rest and we'll talk soon

peter

best of luck...keep the faith
and please let me/us know asap
peter
ps..i do very little " waving " LOL

verty important to stay positive 11
we wish you all the luck
posts.topic: The latest scoop on my operation

posts.text:
you really must do your homework when making such a big decision..this group is great and will help anyway they can
please give all info (stage/grade/when/where) so group give better advice..but only you can make it !!

keep the faith
ASK AWAY !!!

as my uro said to me "yes your going to die...BUT not from this "
i am in same boat..waiting for path report tomorrow..i just keep thinking..worst case , out comes bladder..change of life style BUT alive !!!

hang in there

please dont laugh @ me ..but was complaining to s/o about clfs hurting..she said do you realize that you havent worn shoes in a week..DAH !!!
put on shoes AND 100% BETTER (NOT COMPLETELY) BUT WHAT A DIFFERENCE

so to have bothered everyone..but maybe it will help down the road

thank you
peter

quick question if i may..had may 1st turb last wed
still bleeding but whats worst is i'm having a very tough time walking..calfs really hurt..they had put
compression on legs
thoughts ??

thanking everyone in advance
yes waiting for path report on monday

congrads on getting thru operation
peter from vegas

susan , please remain strong..we will all get thru this awful time
peter

as far as giving blood is concerned..my s/o gave after 2 yrs cancer free.. at red cross
i would ask if you want to give(great that anyone wants to donate)
enjoy your rest..and thank you for being a part of this forum
posts.topic: Monday and then that is it!!

posts.text: wishing the best for you

make sure lab/doc sends slides NOT just reports..took 2 wks extra because lab sent only report
do you know who doc @ s/k will be ??
we.re using dr bouchner

i'm going s/k on 8/1 to have bladder/prostate removed and get ext bag
s/k is suppose to be 1 of the best. they are very professional and do over 200 ops per year
will be expensive having tammie stay in city but dont want her commuting back/froth to CT
if i can answer any questions..please ask
This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.
i also have prostate cancer (2 spots) and since i elected to have bladder removed..out comes prostate ..isnt 5.8 a very high number??
posts.topic: Both prostate cancer and bladder cancer at the same time

posts.text: shouldnt have been taking cumadin during operation..my thought !!
posts.topic: not sure where to write this

posts.text: you'll do fine
posts.topic: 1st BCG tomorrow and stressed to the gills

posts.text:
wonderful to see ya back on-line and with great news about dad..congrads !!
and everyday he WILL get alittle better
peter
posts.topic: Eventually I\'m on line - Our update :)

posts.text: great news..sleep , your body knows what it needs

just a quick note to wish you well tomorrow
its been 5 wks since operation..time flys and so it will for you
please remember to walk as much as possilble in beging..very important
we're leaving tomorrow for vegas but we'll be check you progress
best..peter

thank you all and may all "your" news be good
peter
yes it will be good to gethome to vegas

went to see doc @ s/k in NYC yesterday to have stables out and get path report
CANCER FREE doc said..cancer stayed within bladder/prostate..lumhp nodes clear !!!
asked when we could head back to vegas he..NOW !!!!  
i was also very lucky to meet "belihigh" from this web site who is having operation sept 5th (best of luck)
i want to thank everyone on this site..esp..gene/ginger/peterk for helping me thru this
"WHAT A SITE THIS IS !!!!"
thanks again
please write (This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.)should anyone have any questions
peter
having 2nd thoughts about using dr bochner??

so sorry i havent gotten back to you
would love to meet you
we should be in doc office about 9:30 (appt for 10:30)dont know about traffic in city...so better safe then sorry
i will wear blue sweat pants/red "UNLV" T-SHIRT..5,11" 228lbs/blad with glass (wish everyone wont laugh !!!! )
hoping to get path report/stables out and an idea when we can head for vegas.
i wish you well and please feel free to ask any questions
your friend
peter

whew...i'm such a baby !!!
thanks for info
ya gotta love this site !!!
peter
how painful is it to have stables out!!
i,m having my operation on 8/1..hope mine goes nearly as good as yours..congrads
could you please send a picture ??
posts.topic: Bag people, swim suit dilema solved!!!!

posts.text:
good luck with dad
could you please tell me which devision he decided on also age
i ask since i'm having my bladder'prostate remove 8/1
thank you ..i know the stress your under

1 very important thing to remember is..without this operation (regardless of dervision)WE WOULD DIE !!!
i seem to forget that every now & then..sorry
so no matter which you choose..you will live..you will adapte and you will be fine
you must have faith
its up to you

best wishes to you
i have my operation on 8/1
we'll have to compare stiches !!!!
how long before gene was allowed to drive again ??
thank you all for prayes and wishes
those "jelly bean" looking things..are the lemop nodes ??

i thank you for your prayers (all welcome)
yes i know about chemo having gone thru breast cancer (had 1 breast removed) with my s/o
i think i'm alittle relaxed is because "we" NOW have a game plan..as EVERYONE has said..the waiting sucks !! 
i know it wont be easy but the help of all the great people on this forumen and family/friends back east..it'll be ok
hoping to be CANCER FREE
PETER

thank you for your concern..
home is in Ct..all family is located there..sister-in law has offered her full apt for us to stay..as long as we want (she would like it if we didnt come back to vegas)
i know usc and other west hospitals are great..but also is sloan-kerrting
after reading all the great comments i realize everyone is different...i'm just trying to prepare (as much as i can) as to whats going to happen to me

and i was saying..where we 5yrs ago in cancer research ?
and having faith in clincal tairls and whats in the "pipeline"

i agree..i dont think i'll wait till they grow me a new bladder ! 

take care my friend

rick..just had my turb with dr zommick from the urology specialist group.
we were shocked when he said..if bladder has to come out " GO TO USC"..THIS IS THE sameDOC who PUSHED NEO ON US TO BE DONE BE HIS "PARTNER" !!!

just another opotion
peter

having my 1st turb on wed and starting to get very nervous..been reading all the messages and have a few questions..if i may
1-are you always "knocked-out" ?
2-how long is "normal" turb?
3-do most people go home same day "
4-how long before path report comes back
5-does doc give any info when your in recovery room
6-what are reaction to turb
7- how long before back to "normal"
i understand everyone is different..just looking for some sort of avg
when i had "scope" job , ended up with bad infection and had a 2 day in hospital to clear it up..adding to my nervousiveness (sp?)

thanking everyone in advance

may i ask what made you decide on "ext" bag ?
i will (i'm quite sure) will a a decision to make

thank you for sharing

just trying to get all the info i can , so i'll have an idea of what i what should (and i believe he will) say bladder has to go
thanks for ALL the info
posts.topic: Bag people---any ideas on swimming  garb, to cover the bag

posts.text:
i'm considering "indiana/ext pouch..
are there any restrictions as to sitting for long periods/leaving heavy objects/diet
is there a film showing how one drains the pouch..cant picture it (cath above belt line ??)

thanks in advance
posts.topic: Bag people---any ideas on swimming  garb, to cover the bag

posts.text:
i have my "scaping" on 4/30..afew days till path reports come back..then decision time..but cant do anything till i know stage/grade (right?)
thank everyone for thier input...waiting sucks (as someone else said ) !!!
what can i except from trubt..much pain/bleeding ? , but able to go home that day ..and what about going back to work

name of group is "urology specialists"..they have about 8drs and the 1 female does the "neo"
any other choices in vegas ??
thank you
hope hubby is doing well
posts.topic: New Neobladder - Need Advice about leaking

posts.text:
having full body bone scan next wed..have had ct scan/ultrasound and since having ended up with "blood infection" from scope/prostate biospy was in hospital for 2days and had battery of test.
why both ext bag plus neo ?? was leaning towards ext one.
using large urology group..comes recommened from other drs/nv cancer inst/past users..once "scraping" is done..i will take results to nv cancer inst for 2nd opion
still nervous if cancer has spread
did anyone have signs of bc coming on..other then blood in urine

thank you for all the help
posts.topic: New Neobladder - Need Advice about leaking

posts.text:
i thought they ALWAYS took prostate when they took bladder???
did i miss something ??

congrads on quick bike ride.. i understand , cant wait to get back on mine
what ever decision you made in the past were the "best" at that time...we cant go back and 2nd guess..please look forward and stay strong..grampadonut
my SO had a port for her breast cancer..everything was alot easier/cleaner with port

JUST AWSOME
ALL YOU WOMEN ARE SOMETHING ELSE !!!
posts.topic: Oh Boy!  Do they LOVE Me at the Hospital!  LOL &amp;quot;Again&amp;quot; SECOND OPINIONS PLEASE!!!

posts.text:
could be dr wants to make sure they got the lil creaters..
mine was all in bladder , so didnt need chemo
best of luck
peter
WHAT STAGE/GRADE WAS HE ?..MAKES A BIG DIFFERENCE...I WAS T1-G2

you are so wise/real to have game plan(s) should thiks not go as accepted
best wishes
peter

cute..yes i can relate to that !!
thank you for the smile
posts.topic: If My Body Was A Car

posts.text:
how true
we need more people stating the facts.."not my child"..just wont cut it anymore
thank you
i didnt you rode harleys..me too

so sorry about your friend..its so tought to find one..then to lose them is even tougher
good luck
peter
ps..remember the "good" times
